I'm happy to help you with managing your medications! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your personal medical records or prescription information. I can't provide you with specific dosage and frequency information for your blood thinners or any other medications.

Instead, I strongly recommend that you consult with your healthcare provider or pharmacist to get accurate and personalized information about your medication regimen. They can review your medical history, including your hospital stay, and provide you with the correct dosage and frequency instructions for your medications.

Additionally, you can also consider the following steps to ensure you're managing your medications correctly:

1. Keep a medication log or pill box to track your daily medication intake.
2. Set reminders on your phone or calendar to take your medications at the same time every day.
3. Ask your healthcare provider or pharmacist to explain any changes to your medication regimen after your hospital stay.
4. Review your medication labels and instructions carefully to ensure you understand the correct dosage and frequency.
5. Consider enrolling in a medication therapy management program or working with a pharmacist to help you manage your medications.

Remember, it's always better to err on the side of caution when it comes to managing your medications. If you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to reach out to your healthcare provider or pharmacist for guidance.
